text: Triosteum angustifolium, commonly known as feverwort, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is found Eastern North America. The yellow-orange berries can be dried, roasted, ground, and used as a coffee substitute. ==References== Category:Caprifoliaceae Category:Flora of Eastern Canada Category:Flora of the Northeastern United States Category:Flora of the Southeastern United States Category:Flora of the North-Central United States
title: Triosteum perfoliatum
